article.title: Halfspace depths for scatter, concentration and shape matrices

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure shows the level sets of scatter halfspace depth for two probability measures. Which probability measures are they?
choices: Bivariate t-distribution with 3 degrees of freedom & Bivariate Exponential distribution.
Bivariate Multinormal distribution & Bivariate distribution with independent Laplace marginals.
Bivariate Multinormal distribution & Bivariate distribution with independent Cauchy marginals.
Bivariate Uniform distribution & Bivariate Logistic distribution.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure illustrates the concept of (geodesic and linear) quasi-concavity of scatter halfspace depth along different paths. Which path consistently exhibits quasi-concavity for all three probability measures displayed?
choices: Geodesic path.
Linear path.
Harmonic path.
None of the paths consistently exhibit quasi-concavity for all three probability measures.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure displays contour plots of shape halfspace depth based on the Str scale functional. Which of the following statements is TRUE based on the information presented in the figure?
choices: Shape halfspace depth contours are always smooth regardless of the underlying probability distribution.
The maximal shape halfspace depth is always achieved at the "true" Str-shape matrix.
Shape halfspace depth decreases monotonically as we move away from the deepest shape matrix along any direction.
The maximal shape halfspace depth is always higher for Cauchy distributions compared to Gaussian distributions.

multiple_choice_question.text: This figure analyzes the returns of the Nasdaq Composite and S&P 500 indices using scatter and shape depths, as well as distance measures.  What key advantage does shape depth demonstrate over distance measures in this application?
choices: Shape depth is more sensitive to changes in overall volatility size.
Shape depth is more robust to outliers compared to distance measures.
Shape depth is better at detecting days with atypical shape patterns, even if the overall scale is not significantly different.
Shape depth provides more accurate estimates of the scatter and shape matrices.
Location halfspace depth
Simplicial depth
Scatter halfspace depth
Spatial depth
